alert.note: Alert for Estill; Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 9:49PM EDT until July 28 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Estill County in east central Kentucky... Northwestern Lee County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 949 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Irvine, Ravenna, Doe Creek, Pryse, Texola, Cow Creek, Willow Tree, Pitts, Shade, Wagersville, Evelyn, South Irvine, North Irvine, Cobhill, Station Camp, Crystal, West Irvine, Pinnacle, Wisemantown and Old Landing. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
